ai.summary: Crowan BR 55 is a short, easy hike in the UK, covering about 0.9 km. It’s suitable for beginners and anyone looking for a quick, low-effort outdoor stroll on a well-marked route.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail is mostly flat or gently undulating and runs along a well-marked path. Surfaces vary from compacted gravel to grass; in wet conditions expect mud, so sturdy footwear is recommended. The route offers simple countryside scenery with minimal elevation change.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy shoes and dress in layers, with a waterproof jacket if rain is possible. Stay on the marked path, be aware of livestock or gates, and tell someone your plans and expected return time. Bring a map or offline navigation and a charged phone; carry a small first aid kit and basic supplies.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or lightweight boots
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers and a waterproof jacket)
Map, compass, or GPS device (or a fully charged phone with offline maps)
Power bank to keep your phone charged
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with particularly pleasant conditions in spring and autumn (roughly March–October).

seo.title: Crowan BR 55 – Easy 0.9 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Crowan BR 55, a short 0.9 km easy hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety, and gear for a quick outdoor stroll.
